page.title: 11PLAS NEWYDD,LLANGOLLEN.
page.content: {Plas Newydd}is on the south side of Llangollen it is owned by{Glyndwr {Council.}It used to be the home of the ladies of Llangollen,{Lady Eleanor {Butler}and{Miss Sarah Ponsonby. The inside of the house is covered in oak carvings. Plas Newydd is used as a major tourist attraction.The stained glass window in the library is from {Valle Crucis Abbey.}One of the rooms in the house has been turned into a miniature museum showing the ladies possessions. In the gardens is a circle of stones called the{Bardic {Circle,}the stones were placed there when the{National Eisteddfod}was held in Llangollen.The house and grounds are now used for garden fetes and the Mayday carnival.In the gardens there is a dairy,a water tower,stables and a bowling green.The house and grounds are open{10am to 7pm}from{May-Sept.
